TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ConformanceLevel extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the amount of input or output checking that and objects perform.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Xml.ConformanceLevel Auto = int32(0)

Docs.summary:
The or object automatically detects whether document-level or fragment-level checking should be performed, and does the appropriate checking. If you're wrapping another or object, the outer object doesn't do any additional conformance checking. Conformance checking is left up to the underlying object.
See the <xref:System.Xml.XmlReaderSettings.ConformanceLevel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriterSettings.ConformanceLevel%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties for details on how the compliance level is determined.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Xml.ConformanceLevel Document = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The XML data complies with the rules for a well-formed [XML 1.0 document](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#sec-well-formed), as defined by the W3C.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Xml.ConformanceLevel Fragment = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The XML data is a [well-formed XML fragment](http://www.w3.org/TR/2006/REC-xml-20060816/#wf-entities), as defined by the W3C.
